page.title: 05HOUSING IN LAMLASH NORTH.
page.content: The houses at the north east area of the village are mainly old,big and made of sandstone.These houses are used mainly for boarding etc.The situation and area they take differs a lot to the more modern establishements,being fairly close to the coast and taking up a fair amount of land. Moving along the village the houses spread out more and make a considerable change being much smaller and further away from the sea.There are some areas in the centre of the village that are crammed together a bit more such as the Hamilton Terraces built for the clearances.These houses and terraces continue to carry on a south westerly direction while the road where most of the other houses previously followed goes in a more southerly direction.
